intro: Cacalia deppeana, commonly known as the purple evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Cacalia deppeana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
